Review.Titre: Save your money...scam.
Review.Contenu: I was researching how to fix a printing problem online and I took a gamble with this company/business, which was a "sponsored ad" at the top of the Google results. Immediately upon downloading my computer was acting boggy and glitchy. I was prompted to download the file repeatedly for roughly 5 minutes and finally I lucked out with a working file. After the program scanned my computer (very quickly might I add, I was impressed.) I was subsequently asked to download over SIXTY drivers. Now I know I am a little behind when it comes to technology, so I must assume part responsibility for operator error, but the program was basically harassing me and the trickery aspect of their marketing was obviously apparent. Needless to say, I reluctantly entered my payment information with a sense of calamity through their posted "money back guarantee". Once I realized I had been had, it was too late because even though I received a very prompt and punctual automated response to my refund request with a ticket number, I have yet to be followed up with by any company personnel... over a week later, still nothing. Keep your money and save your time. This appears to be nothing more than an intentionally confusing click-bait scam.

Review.Titre: My review of "Hellish" Driver Easy
Review.Contenu: Driver easy is super crap. I done a amazing fresh install of Windows and it was running fine. But I didn't have the drivers to access my data drive that was connected on the scu sata port on my motherboard and the driver to be able to use an xbox controller on my PC. So I installed Driver Easy and then proceeded to update all my drivers; as although I didn't need them, I thought it would lead to greater performance and benefits. To my dismay, this application's automatic Driver updates caused my PC to become superslow and caused an error with the in built graphics card on the motherboard. The paid service which is designed to improve PC experience done the exact opposite.To add even more insult to injury, the driver easy program failed to create a system restore point before updating the drivers, thus making it very difficult to rollback the negative changes.I was able, by the grace of God, to reverse some of the damages caused by this program by downloading drivers from my motherboard's manufacturer website. But still, my PC is not as fast as it was compared to before it was attacked by DriverEasy!All in all, from my experience I recommend to absolutely avoid this malicious program as it seeks to destroy PCs and not improve them!

Review.Contenu: A short summary: Driver Easy did update my drivers that were out of date, but the updates did nothing to resolve my audio issue   || Driver Easy updates did nothing to resolve my audio issue. (I have already submitted this information earlier through your website.Description:My problem started 6 months ago when my computer's motherboard failed.  My computer is a HP-Pavilion 27" Touch Screen All in One - Intel Corei7   12GB Memory - 256B Solid State Drive.  Anyway, when my computer was returned from Best Buy's "Computer Center", with a new motherboard, my audio would not work despite the fact the built-in speakers were connected.  Somehow the computer was not recognizing that the speakers were in place ... When one right hand clicked on the Speaker Icon the drop down showed the “Speaker Set -Up (Unknown) - OFF".  Well, long story short ... the store, itself, did "something" and got the speakers to work again but the manager told me a future Windows update might disable the speakers again.  Well, yesterday I had two Window 10 updates which did nothing to my speakers, but my Windows Search feature became disabled (which has happened before) so I tried my usual fixes, and nothing happened.  So, then I backed out the updates and still nothing happened.  It was then I downloaded Media Creation Tool I22H2 (which was advertised to fix this issue) and did fix my Window Search problem but somehow now has disabled my speakers!  I then searched the internet for how to fix the speaker problem and came to Driver Easy which I purchased and updated my drivers which has not solved my issue.Sorry for such a winded story but I want to give you all the details.  Sincerely,Thomas Diemer

I then removed the card from the computer and used the computer for a few days and then reinstalled the card which still does not work so I am going to try a different Brand of card. Review.Titre: It took several tries to update all of…
Review.Contenu: It took several tries to update all of my drivers.  There were error messages initially, but eventually all drivers were updated.  Problem is my keyboard now does not work on my laptop.  I have contacted tech support which has requested much more information to resolve the problem.  I am currently gathering this information.  This certainly is not the "two-click easy" update process claimed in the ads.As of 8/11/23 problem still has not been resolved. I took the computer to a repair shop which solved some of the problems.  Driver Easy customer service wasn't much help, as they were slow to respond.  I have requested a refund of the purchase price.  Driver Easy created more problems than it resolved.  They should rename it "Driver Difficult".

This COULD be a great program, COULD be a must-have for any PC, but some of your oporations still need work obviously.  Two days lag before you can expect a customer service reply?

Review.Titre: Causing more work than it is worth!
Review.Contenu: Not happy.  This has happened twice now and always after I run an update with Driver Easy on my wife’s laptop.  It updates the Intel UHD driver and shifts it to 360 HZ so the laptop screen effectively becomes useless.  I spend the rest of the day figuring out how to isolate the driver properties and figure out how to set the display to 60 Hz.  When you “Update All”, it tells you that it is creating a restore point but when you go back in after it eliminates the laptop display, it shows that no restore points have been made.

It is sufficient for the average user, but falls short for the advanced user.

Review.Titre: Simple to use. But use with caution.
Review.Contenu: The software was easy to use, but in the end did not really solve my problem. It was not updating drivers...it was in rolling back drivers that had updated beyond what my hardware could handle that in the end solved the problem.  So this software has its place.  Be careful allowing any program to update drivers to older hardware.  However, I should say it helped keep many drivers updated and in line with Microsoft's own updates that to my surprise does not always keep drivers updated to match newer or revised drivers.  Which makes this simple to use software valuable.

This was viewed by me as a  deceptive practice. I asked for the authorization to be removed through support and it is supposedly done.  Other than that the program works fine in finding and installing needed drivers.  If not for the order download form, I would have rated the program as excellent!

Review.Contenu: Worked very well. I bought a second monitor so I wanted to enable the PC onboard graphics as well as having my other monitor plugged into the dedicated graphics card (a desktop tower PC). I enabled the onboard graphics in the BIOS but it was missing the driver. Windows couldn't identify and download it. Rather than open up my machine to try and find out what the graphics chip was, I just ran Driver Easy and it immediately identified the missing driver and the ones that needed updating. I wasn't prepared to wait the 5 hours for the driver to download using the FREE version of Driver Easy so I bought the subscription (which isn't bad for a year). It download/installed and my monitor worked straight after the reboot. Well worth it to save some time, though I may only use it the once, so you will have to factor in whether it is worth it to you.

Review.Titre: Keeping drivers up to date on Windows with a permanent for life license.

Now I use it because I must in order to enjoy the A rated video games. Driver Easy made updating my drivers a no-brainer and is worth every cent I paid for the license. I was unable to install Intel Arc and Iris Xe Graphics - WHQL for Windows 11 Pro from Intel - my PC become unresponsive and I had to revert to previous settings. It would have been great if Easy Driver updater database had recognised that my PC meets the requirements to install the Arc drivers.

I know from experience writing this kind of code is not easy.Now, if you could get rid of entering in the 25 digit product key, I would have given you a five start rating. As it is, I have the product key taped to the keyboards. Not that I'm going to run it every day but since 2009, I have had to reload the operating systems more than 5 less than 10 times. (One company I worked for in Silicon Valley (BTI) supplied auto dealerships with inventory software. If they missed a monthly payment, they'd activate the kill code. Not paying didn't happen often.)Regards, Mike Tuccinardi

When I find my PC isn't running as fast as it should be, or the speakers aren't blasting as loud as I'm used to, all I gotta do is let Driver Easy do it's thing, and boom! Problem solved!So yes, I HIGHLY recommend Driver Easy to keep your computer running smoothly, and at an affordable price!

Review.Titre: My desktop system was unusable until Driver Easy!
Review.Contenu: I built a very high end desktop system early this year. I built it with best components I could afford. It's maxed out on memory and has one of the fastest Intel 13th gen CPUs available.When it runs it was wicked fast and made CPU/GPU intensive jobs a breeze. But after a recent Windows update it became more and more unstable. If it went to sleep it would not wake up except by rebooting. Often it would just reboot for no reason. My dream system was useless. It became a huge frustrating time suck. I spent days searching for advice on how to address the severe errors in the event log. While searching for information on Windows driver issues I came upon Driver Easy. I figured I'd try Driver Easy before spending days to reinstall Windows, all the hardware drivers and all the applications I use. I downloaded the trial version (this is a GREAT idea) and Driver Easy found a very large number of possible driver issues. I used the manual method to find and repair a couple of the more serious driver issues. Driver Easy found many issues that the motherboard's manufacturer (ASUS) or the other major components (e.g. MSI 4070 GPU) or Windows update did not address.After using the Driver Easy trial version my system had fewer problems booting (yes, I had booting issues too). The improvement in stability was dramatic and I decided to purchase a license in order to get the "automatic" fix procedure to address the rest of the problems it found.Driver Easy is the real deal and absolutely lives up to its advertising. I let it automatically repair a large number of suggested driver issues. My system is now rock solid and stable. Before Driver Easy, my system would reboot several times a day and even rebooting took several tries. Driver Easy saved me *days* of work to reinstall Windows, all the hardware drivers and dozens of applications. Thank you for a great product! I'd give it more stars if I could...:-)
